children.text: [![LegislationCrest](/images/crests/ukpga.gif)](/ukpga/2022/17/introduction/enacted?view=plain)
Local Government (Disqualification) Act 2022
2022 CHAPTER 17
An Act to make provision about the grounds on which a person is disqualifiedfrom being elected to, or holding, certain positions in local government inEngland.
[28th April 2022]

Be it enacted by the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the adviceand consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this presentParliament assembled, and by the authority of the same, as follows:—
Grounds of disqualification
Members of local authorities in England etc
In the Local Government Act 1972, after section 81 insert—
“81ADisqualification relating to sexual offences etc (England)
A person is disqualified for being elected or being a member of a localauthority in England if the person is subject to—
any relevant notification requirements, or
a relevant order.
In this section “relevant notification requirements” means—
the notification requirements of Part 2 of the Sexual Offences Act 2003;
the notification requirements of Part 2 of the Sex Offenders (Jersey) Law2010;
the notification requirements of Part 2 of the Criminal Justice (SexOffenders and Miscellaneous Provisions) (Bailiwick of Guernsey) Law 2013;
the notification requirements of Schedule 1 to the Criminal Justice Act2001 (an Act of Tynwald: c. 4).
In this section “relevant order” means—
a sexual harm prevention order under section 345 of the Sentencing Code;
a sexual harm prevention order under section 103A of the Sexual OffencesAct 2003;
a sexual offences prevention order under section 104 of that Act;
a sexual risk order under section 122A of that Act;
a risk of sexual harm order under section 123 of that Act;
a risk of sexual harm order under section 2 of the Protection of Childrenand Prevention of Sexual Offences (Scotland) Act 2005;
a sexual risk order under section 27 of the Abusive Behaviour and SexualHarm (Scotland) Act 2016;
a restraining order under Article 10 of the Sex Offenders (Jersey) Law2010;
a child protection order under Article 11 of that Law;
a sexual offences prevention order under section 18 of the Criminal Justice(Sex Offenders and Miscellaneous Provisions) (Bailiwick of Guernsey) Law 2013;
a risk of sexual harm order under section 22 of that Law;
a sexual offences prevention order under section 1 of the Sex Offenders Act2006 (an Act of Tynwald: c. 20);
a risk of sexual harm order under section 5 of that Act.
For the purposes of subsection (1)(a), a person who is subject to anyrelevant notification requirements is not to be regarded as disqualifieduntil—

the expiry of the ordinary period allowed for making an appeal orapplication against the conviction, finding, caution, order or certificationin respect of which the person is subject to the relevant notificationrequirements, or
if such an appeal or application is made, the date on which it is finallydisposed of or abandoned or fails because it is not prosecuted.
For the purposes of subsection (1)(b), a person who is subject to arelevant order is not to be regarded as disqualified until—
the expiry of the ordinary period allowed for making an appeal against therelevant order, or
if such an appeal is made, the date on which it is finally disposed of orabandoned or fails because it is not prosecuted.”
In that Act, in section 80 (disqualifications for election and holdingoffice as member of local authority), after subsection (5) insert—
“(5A)See also section 81A (disqualification relating to sexual offences etc(England)).”

In regulation 7 of the Charter Trustee Regulations 1996 ([S.I.1996/263](/id/uksi/1996/263?view=plain "Go to item of legislation"))(appointment of local government electors as trustees), in paragraph (6),after “(2)” insert “, 81A”.
In the Local Elections (Parishes and Communities) (England and Wales) Rules2006 ([S.I. 2006/3305](/id/uksi/2006/3305?view=plain "Go to item oflegislation"))—
in paragraph 7(b)(i) of Schedule 2 (rules for elections of Councillors of aParish or Community), for “and 81” substitute “, 81 and 81A”;
in paragraph 7(b)(i) of Schedule 3 (rules for elections of Councillors of aParish or Community where combined with other election or referendum), for“and 81” substitute “, 81 and 81A”.
In the Local Authorities (Mayoral Elections) (England and Wales)Regulations 2007 ([S.I. 2007/1024](/id/uksi/2007/1024?view=plain "Go to itemof legislation"))—
in paragraph 9(b)(i) of Schedule 1 (the Mayoral Elections Rules), for “and81” substitute “, 81 and 81A”;
in paragraph 9(b)(i) of Schedule 3 (Mayoral Election (Combination of Polls)Rules), for “and 81” substitute “, 81 and 81A”.

In regulation 5 of the Local Authority (Public Health, Health and WellbeingBoards and Health Scrutiny) Regulations 2013 ([S.I.2013/218](/id/uksi/2013/218?view=plain "Go to item of legislation"))(appointments to Health and Wellbeing Boards), in paragraph (2)—
after “(d)” insert “or section 81A”;
for “or criminal conviction” substitute “, criminal conviction or sexualoffences etc”.
Mayors of combined authorities
The Local Democracy, Economic Development and Construction Act 2009 isamended in accordance with subsections (2) and (3).
In Schedule 5B (mayors for combined authority areas: further provisionabout elections), after paragraph 9 insert—
“9A(1)A person is disqualified for being elected or holding office as themayor for the area of a combined authority if the person is subject to—
any relevant notification requirements, or
a relevant order.
In this paragraph “relevant notification requirements” mean—
the notification requirements of Part 2 of the Sexual Offences Act 2003;
the notification requirements of Part 2 of the Sex Offenders (Jersey) Law2010;
the notification requirements of Part 2 of the Criminal Justice (SexOffenders and Miscellaneous Provisions) (Bailiwick of Guernsey) Law 2013;
the notification requirements of Schedule 1 to the Criminal Justice Act2001 (an Act of Tynwald: c. 4).
In this paragraph “relevant order” means—
a sexual harm prevention order under section 345 of the Sentencing Code;
a sexual harm prevention order under section 103A of the Sexual OffencesAct 2003;
a sexual offences prevention order under section 104 of that Act;
a sexual risk order under section 122A of that Act;
a risk of sexual harm order under section 123 of that Act;
a risk of sexual harm order under section 2 of the Protection of Childrenand Prevention of Sexual Offences (Scotland) Act 2005;
a sexual risk order under section 27 of the Abusive Behaviour and SexualHarm (Scotland) Act 2016;
a restraining order under Article 10 of the Sex Offenders (Jersey) Law2010;
a child protection order under Article 11 of that Law;
a sexual offences prevention order under section 18 of that Law;
a risk of sexual harm order under section 22 of that Law;
a sexual offences prevention order under section 1 of the Sex Offenders Act2006 (an Act of Tynwald: c. 20);
a risk of sexual harm order under section 5 of that Act.
For the purposes of sub-paragraph (1)(a), a person who is subject to anyrelevant notification requirements is not to be regarded as disqualifieduntil—

the expiry of the ordinary period allowed for making an appeal orapplication against the conviction, finding, caution, order or certificationin respect of which the person is subject to the relevant notificationrequirements, or
if such an appeal or application is made, the date on which it is finallydisposed of or abandoned or fails because it is not prosecuted.
For the purposes of sub-paragraph (1)(b), a person who is subject to arelevant order is not to be regarded as disqualified until—
the expiry of the ordinary period allowed for making an appeal against therelevant order, or
if such an appeal is made, the date on which it is finally disposed of orabandoned or fails because it is not prosecuted.”
In Schedule 5C (mayors for combined authority areas: PCC functions), inparagraph 9, for “and 9” substitute “, 9 and 9A”.
In the Combined Authorities (Mayoral Elections) Order 2017 ([S.I.2017/67](/id/uksi/2017/67?view=plain "Go to item of legislation"))—
in paragraph 9(1)(b) of Schedule 1 (the Combined Authority MayoralElections Rules), after “9” insert “and 9A”;
in paragraph 9(1)(b) of Schedule 3 (Combined Authority Mayoral Election(Combination of Polls) Rules), after “9” insert “and 9A”.
The Mayor of London and London Assembly members
In the Greater London Authority Act 1999, after section 21 insert—
“21ADisqualification relating to sexual offences etc
A person is disqualified from being elected or being the Mayor or anAssembly member if the person is subject to—
any relevant notification requirements, or
a relevant order.
In this section “relevant notification requirements” means—
the notification requirements of Part 2 of the Sexual Offences Act 2003;
the notification requirements of Part 2 of the Sex Offenders (Jersey) Law2010;
the notification requirements of Part 2 of the Criminal Justice (SexOffenders and Miscellaneous Provisions) (Bailiwick of Guernsey) Law 2013;
the notification requirements of Schedule 1 to the Criminal Justice Act2001 (an Act of Tynwald: c. 4).
In this section “relevant order” means—
a sexual harm prevention order under section 345 of the Sentencing Code;
a sexual harm prevention order under section 103A of the Sexual OffencesAct 2003;
a sexual offences prevention order under section 104 of that Act;
a sexual risk order under section 122A of that Act;
a risk of sexual harm order under section 123 of that Act;
a risk of sexual harm order under section 2 of the Protection of Childrenand Prevention of Sexual Offences (Scotland) Act 2005;
a sexual risk order under section 27 of the Abusive Behaviour and SexualHarm (Scotland) Act 2016;
a restraining order under Article 10 of the Sex Offenders (Jersey) Law2010;
a child protection order under Article 11 of that Law;
a sexual offences prevention order under section 18 of the Criminal Justice(Sex Offenders and Miscellaneous Provisions) (Bailiwick of Guernsey) Law 2013;
a risk of sexual harm order under section 22 of that Law;
a sexual offences prevention order under section 1 of the Sex Offenders Act2006 (an Act of Tynwald: c. 20);
a risk of sexual harm order under section 5 of that Act.
For the purposes of subsection (1)(a), a person who is subject to anyrelevant notification requirements is not to be regarded as disqualifieduntil—

the expiry of the ordinary period allowed for making an appeal orapplication against the conviction, finding, caution, order or certificationin respect of which the person is subject to the relevant notificationrequirements, or
if such an appeal or application is made, the date on which it is finallydisposed of or abandoned or fails because it is not prosecuted.
For the purposes of subsection (1)(b), a person who is subject to arelevant order is not to be regarded as disqualified until—
the expiry of the ordinary period allowed for making an appeal against therelevant order, or
if such an appeal is made, the date on which it is finally disposed of orabandoned or fails because it is not prosecuted.
This section applies in relation to being returned as a London member undersection 11 otherwise than at an election as it applies in relation to beingelected.”
In the Greater London Authority Elections Rules 2007 ([S.I.2007/3541](/id/uksi/2007/3541?view=plain "Go to item of legislation"))—
in paragraph 7(2)(b)(i) of Schedule 1 (the Constituency Member ElectionRules), after “21” insert “or 21A”;
in paragraph 9(2)(c)(i) of Schedule 2 (the London Member Election Rules),after “21” insert “or 21A”;
in paragraph 8(2)(b)(i) of Schedule 3 (the Mayoral Election Rules), after“21” insert “or 21A”;
in paragraph 7(2)(b)(i) of Schedule 5 (the Constituency Members ElectionRules for elections combined with a relevant election or referendum), after“21” insert “or 21A”;
in paragraph 9(2)(c)(i) of Schedule 6 (the London Member Election Rules forelections combined with a relevant election or referendum), after “21” insert“or 21A”;
in paragraph 8(2)(b)(i) of Schedule 7 (the Mayoral Election Rules forelections combined with a relevant election or referendum), after “21” insert“or 21A”.
Supplementary and final provisions
References to Channel Islands or Isle of Man legislation

The Secretary of State may by regulations make such amendments to anyrelevant provision as the Secretary of State considers appropriate inconsequence of the amendment, repeal or re-enactment of any legislation of anyof the Channel Islands or the Isle of Man which is for the time beingspecified in that provision.
In subsection (1) “relevant provision” means—
section 81A of the Local Government Act 1972;
paragraph 9A of Schedule 5B to the Local Democracy, Economic Developmentand Construction Act 2009;
section 21A of the Greater London Authority Act 1999.
Regulations under this section are to be made by statutory instrument.
A statutory instrument containing regulations under this section may not bemade unless a draft of the instrument has been laid before and approved by aresolution of each House of Parliament.
Transitional provision
The amendments made by this Act do not have the effect of disqualifying aperson by reason of the person becoming subject to—
any relevant notification requirements, or
a relevant order,
before the day on which this Act comes into force.

In subsection (1) “relevant notification requirements” and “relevant order”have the same meaning as in section 81A of the Local Government Act 1972,paragraph 9A of Schedule 5B to the Local Democracy, Economic Development andConstruction Act 2009 and section 21A of the Greater London Authority Act 1999as first enacted.
Extent, commencement and short title
This Act extends to England and Wales only.
This Act comes into force at the end of the period of two months beginningwith the day on which it is passed.
This Act may be cited as the Local Government (Disqualification) Act 2022.

title: Local Government (Disqualification) Act 2022
longtitle: An Act to make provision about the grounds on which a person is disqualified from being elected to, or holding, certain positions in local government in England.
